an8.69:1.3.pli: Khattiyaparisā, brāhmaṇaparisā, gahapatiparisā, samaṇaparisā, cātumahārājikaparisā, tāvatiṃsaparisā, māraparisā, brahmaparisā.
an8.69:1.3.eng: The assemblies of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, and ascetics. An assembly of the gods of the four great kings. An assembly of the gods of the thirty-three. An assembly of Māras. An assembly of divinities.

an8.69:1.4.pli: Abhijānāmi kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, anekasataṃ khattiyaparisaṃ upasaṅkamitā.
an8.69:1.4.eng: I recall having approached an assembly of hundreds of aristocrats.

an8.69:1.5.pli: Tatrapi mayā sannisinnapubbañceva sallapitapubbañca sākacchā ca samāpannapubbā.
an8.69:1.5.eng: There I used to sit with them, converse, and engage in discussion.

an8.69:1.6.pli: Tattha yādisako tesaṃ vaṇṇo hoti tādisako mayhaṃ vaṇṇo hoti, yādisako tesaṃ saro hoti tādisako mayhaṃ saro hoti.
an8.69:1.6.eng: And my appearance and voice became just like theirs.

an8.69:1.7.pli: Dhammiyā ca kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṃsemi.
an8.69:1.7.eng: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

an8.69:1.8.eng: But when I spoke they didn’t know:

an8.69:1.9.pli: ‘ko nu kho ayaṃ bhāsati devo vā manusso vā’ti.
an8.69:1.9.eng: ‘Who is this that speaks? Is it a god or a human?’

an8.69:1.10.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
an8.69:1.10.eng: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.

an8.69:1.11.eng: But when I vanished they didn’t know:

an8.69:1.12.pli: ‘ko nu kho ayaṃ antarahito devo vā manusso vā’ti.
an8.69:1.12.eng: ‘Who was that who vanished? Was it a god or a human?’

an8.69:2.1.pli: Abhijānāmi kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, anekasataṃ brāhmaṇaparisaṃ …pe…
an8.69:2.1.eng: I recall having approached an assembly of hundreds of brahmins …

an8.69:2.4.eng: the gods of the four great kings …

an8.69:2.8.pli: Tatrapi mayā sannisinnapubbañceva sallapitapubbañca sākacchā ca samāpannapubbā.
an8.69:2.8.eng: There too I used to sit with them, converse, and engage in discussion.

an8.69:2.9.pli: Tattha yādisako tesaṃ vaṇṇo hoti tādisako mayhaṃ vaṇṇo hoti, yādisako tesaṃ saro hoti tādisako mayhaṃ saro hoti.
an8.69:2.9.eng: And my appearance and voice became just like theirs.

an8.69:2.10.pli: Dhammiyā ca kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṃsemi.
an8.69:2.10.eng: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

an8.69:2.11.eng: But when I spoke they didn’t know:

an8.69:2.12.pli: ‘ko nu kho ayaṃ bhāsati devo vā manusso vā’ti.
an8.69:2.12.eng: ‘Who is this that speaks? Is it a god or a human?’

an8.69:2.13.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
an8.69:2.13.eng: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.

an8.69:2.14.eng: But when I vanished they didn’t know:

an8.69:2.15.pli: ‘ko nu kho ayaṃ antarahito devo vā manusso vā’ti.
an8.69:2.15.eng: ‘Who was that who vanished? Was it a god or a human?’

an8.7:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate acirapakkante devadatte.
an8.7:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain, not long after Devadatta had left.

an8.7:1.2.pli: Tatra bhagavā devadattaṃ ārabbha bhikkhū āmantesi:
an8.7:1.2.eng: There the Buddha spoke to the mendicants about Devadatta:

an8.7:1.3.pli: “sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ attavipattiṃ paccavekkhitā hoti.
an8.7:1.3.eng: “Mendicants, it’s good for a mendicant to check their own failings from time to time.

an8.7:1.4.pli: Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ paravipattiṃ paccavekkhitā hoti.
an8.7:1.4.eng: It’s good for a mendicant to check the failings of others from time to time.

an8.7:1.5.pli: Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ attasampattiṃ paccavekkhitā hoti.
an8.7:1.5.eng: It’s good for a mendicant to check their own successes from time to time.

an8.7:1.6.pli: Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ parasampattiṃ paccavekkhitā hoti.
an8.7:1.6.eng: It’s good for a mendicant to check the successes of others from time to time.

an8.7:1.7.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
an8.7:1.7.eng: Overcome and overwhelmed by eight things that oppose the true teaching, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an8.7:2.2.pli: Lābhena hi, bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.

an8.7:2.9.pli: pāpamittatāya, bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
an8.7:2.9.eng: bad friendship, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an8.7:2.10.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
an8.7:2.10.eng: Overcome and overwhelmed by these eight things that oppose the true teaching, Devadatta is going to a place of loss, to hell, there to remain for an eon, irredeemable.

an8.7:3.1.pli: Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ lābhaṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya vihareyya,
an8.7:3.1.eng: It’s good for a mendicant, whenever they encounter it, to overcome gain …

an8.7:4.1.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ lābhaṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya vihareyya,
an8.7:4.1.eng: What advantage does a mendicant gain by overcoming these eight things?

an8.7:5.1.pli: Yaṃ hissa, bhikkhave, uppannaṃ lābhaṃ anabhibhuyya viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, uppannaṃ lābhaṃ abhibhuyya viharato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti.
an8.7:5.1.eng: The distressing and feverish defilements that might arise in someone who lives without overcoming these eight things do not arise when they have overcome them.

an8.7:5.8.pli: uppannaṃ pāpamittataṃ anabhibhuyya viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, uppannaṃ pāpamittataṃ abhibhuyya viharato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti.

an8.7:5.9.pli: Idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ lābhaṃ abhibhuyya abhibhuyya vihareyya,
an8.7:5.9.eng: This is the advantage that a mendicant gains by overcoming these eight things.

an8.7:6.1.eng: So, mendicants, you should train like this:

an8.7:6.2.eng: ‘Whenever we encounter it, we will overcome gain …

an8.70:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
an8.70:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

an8.70:1.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
an8.70:1.2.eng: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.

an8.70:1.3.pli: Vesāliyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi:
an8.70:1.3.eng: Then, after the meal, on his return from almsround, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,

an8.70:1.5.eng: Let’s go to the Cāpāla Shrine for the day’s meditation.”

an8.70:1.6.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā nisīdanaṃ ādāya bhagavantaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi.
an8.70:1.6.eng: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. Taking his sitting cloth he followed behind the Buddha.

an8.70:2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena cāpālaṃ cetiyaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
an8.70:2.1.eng: Then the Buddha went up to the Cāpāla Shrine, where he sat on the seat spread out.

an8.70:2.2.pli: Nisajja kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi:
an8.70:2.2.eng: When he was seated he said to Venerable Ānanda:

an8.70:3.1.pli: “Ramaṇīyā, ānanda, vesālī, ramaṇīyaṃ udenaṃ cetiyaṃ, ramaṇīyaṃ gotamakaṃ cetiyaṃ, ramaṇīyaṃ sattambaṃ cetiyaṃ, ramaṇīyaṃ bahuputtakaṃ cetiyaṃ; ramaṇīyaṃ sārandadaṃ cetiyaṃ, ramaṇīyaṃ cāpālaṃ cetiyaṃ.
an8.70:3.1.eng: “Ānanda, Vesālī is lovely. And the Udena, Gotamaka, Seven Maidens, Many Sons, Sārandada, and Cāpāla Shrines are all lovely.

an8.70:3.2.pli: Yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, ākaṅkhamāno so, ānanda, kappaṃ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṃ vā.
an8.70:3.2.eng: Whoever has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live for the proper lifespan or what’s left of it.

an8.70:3.3.pli: Tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā. Ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, tathāgato kappaṃ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṃ vā”ti.
an8.70:3.3.eng: The Realized One has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them. If he wished, the Realized One could live for the proper lifespan or what’s left of it.”

an8.70:3.4.pli: Evampi kho āyasmā ānando bhagavatā oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne nāsakkhi paṭivijjhituṃ;
an8.70:3.4.eng: But Ānanda didn’t get it, even though the Buddha dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign.

an8.70:3.6.pli: “tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṃ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṃ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti, yathā taṃ mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto.
an8.70:3.6.eng: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the proper lifespan! May the Holy One please remain for the proper lifespan! That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, out of sympathy for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.” For his mind was as if possessed by Māra.

an8.70:4.2.pli: tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi:
an8.70:4.2.eng: And for a third time, the Buddha said to him:

an8.70:4.3.pli: “ramaṇīyā, ānanda, vesālī, ramaṇīyaṃ udenaṃ cetiyaṃ, ramaṇīyaṃ gotamakaṃ cetiyaṃ, ramaṇīyaṃ sattambaṃ cetiyaṃ, ramaṇīyaṃ bahuputtakaṃ cetiyaṃ, ramaṇīyaṃ sārandadaṃ cetiyaṃ, ramaṇīyaṃ cāpālaṃ cetiyaṃ.
an8.70:4.3.eng: “Ānanda, Vesālī is lovely. And the Udena, Gotamaka, Seven Maidens, Many Sons, Sārandada, and Cāpāla Shrines are all lovely.

an8.70:4.4.pli: Yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, ākaṅkhamāno so, ānanda, kappaṃ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṃ vā.
an8.70:4.4.eng: Whoever has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live for the proper lifespan or what’s left of it.

an8.70:4.5.pli: Tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā …pe… ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, tathāgato kappaṃ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṃ vā”ti.
an8.70:4.5.eng: The Realized One has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them. If he wished, the Realized One could live for the proper lifespan or what’s left of it.”

an8.70:4.6.pli: Evampi kho āyasmā ānando bhagavatā oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne nāsakkhi paṭivijjhituṃ;
an8.70:4.6.eng: But Ānanda didn’t get it, even though the Buddha dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign.

an8.70:4.8.pli: “tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṃ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṃ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti, yathā taṃ mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto.
an8.70:4.8.eng: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the proper lifespan! May the Holy One please remain for the proper lifespan! That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, out of sympathy for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.” For his mind was as if possessed by Māra.

an8.70:5.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi:
an8.70:5.1.eng: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,

an8.70:5.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā bhagavato avidūre aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi.
an8.70:5.3.eng: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. He rose from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before sitting at the root of a tree close by.

an8.70:5.4.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā acirapakkante āyasmante ānande bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.70:5.4.eng: And then, not long after Ānanda had left, Māra the Wicked said to the Buddha:

an8.70:6.1.pli: “Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato. Parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
an8.70:6.1.eng: “Sir, may the Blessed One now be fully extinguished! May the Holy One now be fully extinguished! Now is the time for the full extinguishment of the Buddha.

an8.70:6.2.pli: Bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante, bhagavatā vācā:
an8.70:6.2.eng: Sir, you once made this statement:

an8.70:6.3.pli: ‘na tāvāhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi yāva me bhikkhū na sāvakā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā pattayogakkhemā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārino, sakaṃ ācariyakaṃ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti uppannaṃ parappavādaṃ sahadhammena suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṃ dhammaṃ desessantī’ti.
an8.70:6.3.eng: ‘Wicked One, I shall not be fully extinguished until I have monk disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned, have memorized the teachings, and practice in line with the teaching; not until they practice appropriately, living in line with the teaching; not until they’ve learned their tradition, and explain, teach, assert, establish, clarify, analyze, and reveal; not until they can legitimately and completely refute the doctrines of others that come up, and teach with a demonstrable basis.’

an8.70:6.4.pli: Etarahi, bhante, bhikkhū bhagavato sāvakā viyattā vinītā visāradā pattayogakkhemā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārino, sakaṃ ācariyakaṃ uggahetvā ācikkhanti desenti paññapenti paṭṭhapenti vivaranti vibhajanti uttānīkaronti uppannaṃ parappavādaṃ sahadhammena suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṃ dhammaṃ desenti.
an8.70:6.4.eng: Today you do have such monk disciples.

an8.70:7.1.pli: Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato. Parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
an8.70:7.1.eng: May the Blessed One now be fully extinguished! May the Holy One now be fully extinguished! Now is the time for the full extinguishment of the Buddha.

an8.70:7.2.pli: Bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante, bhagavatā vācā:
an8.70:7.2.eng: Sir, you once made this statement:

an8.70:7.3.pli: ‘na tāvāhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti …pe…
an8.70:7.3.eng: ‘Wicked One, I shall not be fully extinguished until I have nun disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned …’ …

an8.70:7.4.pli: yāva me upāsakā na sāvakā bhavissanti …pe…
an8.70:7.4.eng: ‘Wicked One, I shall not be fully extinguished until I have layman disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned …’ …

an8.70:7.5.pli: yāva me upāsikā na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā pattayogakkhemā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacāriniyo, sakaṃ ācariyakaṃ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti, uppannaṃ parappavādaṃ sahadhammena suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṃ dhammaṃ desessantī’ti.
an8.70:7.5.eng: ‘Wicked One, I shall not be fully extinguished until I have laywoman disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned …’ …

an8.70:7.6.pli: Etarahi, bhante, upāsikā bhagavato sāvikā viyattā vinītā visāradā pattayogakkhemā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacāriniyo, sakaṃ ācariyakaṃ uggahetvā ācikkhanti desenti paññapenti paṭṭhapenti vivaranti vibhajanti uttānīkaronti, uppannaṃ parappavādaṃ sahadhammena suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṃ dhammaṃ desenti.
an8.70:7.6.eng: Today you do have such laywoman disciples.

an8.70:8.1.pli: Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato. Parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
an8.70:8.1.eng: Sir, may the Blessed One now be fully extinguished! May the Holy One be fully extinguished! Now is the time for the full extinguishment of the Buddha.

an8.70:8.2.pli: Bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante, bhagavatā vācā:
an8.70:8.2.eng: Sir, you once made this statement:

an8.70:8.3.pli: ‘na tāvāhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi yāva me idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ na iddhañceva bhavissati phītañca vitthārikaṃ bāhujaññaṃ puthubhūtaṃ, yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitan’ti.
an8.70:8.3.eng: ‘Wicked One, I shall not be fully extinguished until my spiritual path is successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.’

an8.70:8.4.pli: Etarahi, bhante, bhagavato brahmacariyaṃ iddhañceva phītañca vitthārikaṃ bāhujaññaṃ puthubhūtaṃ, yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitaṃ.
an8.70:8.4.eng: Today your spiritual path is successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.

an8.70:9.1.pli: Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato. Parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato”ti.
an8.70:9.1.eng: Sir, may the Blessed One now be fully extinguished! May the Holy One be fully extinguished! Now is the time for the full extinguishment of the Buddha.”

an8.70:9.2.pli: “Appossukko tvaṃ, pāpima, hohi. Naciraṃ tathāgatassa parinibbānaṃ bhavissati.
an8.70:9.2.eng: “Relax, Wicked One. The full extinguishment of the Realized One will be soon.

an8.70:9.3.pli: Ito tiṇṇaṃ māsānaṃ accayena tathāgato parinibbāyissatī”ti.
an8.70:9.3.eng: Three months from now the Realized One will be fully extinguished.”

an8.70:10.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā cāpāle cetiye sato sampajāno āyusaṅkhāraṃ ossaji.
an8.70:10.1.eng: So at the Cāpāla Tree-shrine the Buddha, mindful and aware, surrendered the life force.

an8.70:10.2.pli: Ossaṭṭhe ca bhagavatā āyusaṅkhāre mahābhūmicālo ahosi bhiṃsanako salomahaṃso, devadundubhiyo ca phaliṃsu.
an8.70:10.2.eng: When he did so there was a great earthquake, awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and thunder cracked the sky.

an8.70:10.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi:
an8.70:10.3.eng: Then, understanding this matter, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:

an8.70:10.4.eng: “Comparing the incomparable <j>with the creation of prolonged life,

an8.70:10.5.eng: the sage surrendered the life force.

an8.70:10.7.eng: he shattered self-creation like a suit of armor.”

an8.70:12.3.pli: sumahā vatāyaṃ bhūmicālo bhiṃsanako salomahaṃso, devadundubhiyo ca phaliṃsu.
an8.70:12.3.eng: That was really a very big earthquake; awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and thunder cracked the sky!

an8.70:12.4.pli: Ko nu kho hetu, ko paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāyā”ti?
an8.70:12.4.eng: What’s the cause, what’s the reason for a great earthquake?”

an8.70:13.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.70:13.1.eng: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

an8.70:13.2.eng: “Sir, that was a really big earthquake!

an8.70:13.3.pli: sumahā vatāyaṃ, bhante, bhūmicālo bhiṃsanako salomahaṃso, devadundubhiyo ca phaliṃsu.
an8.70:13.3.eng: That was really a very big earthquake; awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and thunder cracked the sky!

an8.70:13.4.pli: Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāyā”ti?
an8.70:13.4.eng: What’s the cause, what’s the reason for a great earthquake?”

an8.70:14.1.pli: “Aṭṭhime, ānanda, hetū, aṭṭha paccayā mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
an8.70:14.1.eng: “Ānanda, there are these eight causes and reasons for a great earthquake.

an8.70:14.3.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, mahāpathavī udake patiṭṭhitā; udakaṃ vāte patiṭṭhitaṃ; vāto ākāsaṭṭho hoti. So, ānanda, samayo yaṃ mahāvātā vāyanti; mahāvātā vāyantā udakaṃ kampenti; udakaṃ kampitaṃ pathaviṃ kampeti.
an8.70:14.3.eng: This great earth is established on water, the water is established on air, and the air stands in space. At a time when a great wind blows, it stirs the water, and the water stirs the earth.

an8.70:14.4.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, paṭhamo hetu, paṭhamo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
an8.70:14.4.eng: This is the first cause and reason for a great earthquake.

an8.70:15.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā iddhimā cetovasippatto devatā vā mahiddhikā mahānubhāvā. Tassa parittā pathavīsaññā bhāvitā hoti, appamāṇā āposaññā. So imaṃ pathaviṃ kampeti saṅkampeti sampakampeti sampavedheti.
an8.70:15.1.eng: Furthermore, there is an ascetic or brahmin with psychic power who has achieved mastery of the mind, or a god who is mighty and powerful. They’ve developed a limited perception of earth and a limitless perception of water. They make the earth shake and rock and tremble.

an8.70:15.2.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, dutiyo hetu, dutiyo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
an8.70:15.2.eng: This is the second cause and reason for a great earthquake.

an8.70:16.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, yadā bodhisatto tusitā kāyā cavitvā sato sampajāno mātukucchiṃ okkamati, tadāyaṃ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
an8.70:16.1.eng: Furthermore, when the being intent on awakening passes away from the host of joyful gods, he’s conceived in his mother’s belly, mindful and aware. Then the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

an8.70:16.2.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, tatiyo hetu, tatiyo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
an8.70:16.2.eng: This is the third cause and reason for a great earthquake.

an8.70:17.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, yadā bodhisatto sato sampajāno mātukucchismā nikkhamati, tadāyaṃ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
an8.70:17.1.eng: Furthermore, when the being intent on awakening comes out of his mother’s belly mindful and aware, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

an8.70:17.2.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, catuttho hetu, catuttho paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
an8.70:17.2.eng: This is the fourth cause and reason for a great earthquake.

an8.70:18.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambujjhati, tadāyaṃ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
an8.70:18.1.eng: Furthermore, when the Realized One awakens to the supreme perfect awakening, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

an8.70:18.2.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, pañcamo hetu, pañcamo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
an8.70:18.2.eng: This is the fifth cause and reason for a great earthquake.

an8.70:19.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato anuttaraṃ dhammacakkaṃ pavatteti, tadāyaṃ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
an8.70:19.1.eng: Furthermore, when the Realized One rolls forth the supreme Wheel of Dhamma, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

an8.70:19.2.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, chaṭṭho hetu, chaṭṭho paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
an8.70:19.2.eng: This is the sixth cause and reason for a great earthquake.

an8.70:20.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato sato sampajāno āyusaṅkhāraṃ ossajjati, tadāyaṃ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
an8.70:20.1.eng: Furthermore, when the Realized One, mindful and aware, surrenders the life force, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

an8.70:20.2.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, sattamo hetu, sattamo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
an8.70:20.2.eng: This is the seventh cause and reason for a great earthquake.

an8.70:21.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyati, tadāyaṃ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
an8.70:21.1.eng: Furthermore, when the Realized One becomes fully extinguished in the element of extinguishment with no residue, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

an8.70:21.2.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, aṭṭhamo hetu, aṭṭhamo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
an8.70:21.2.eng: This is the eighth cause and reason for a great earthquake.

an8.70:21.3.pli: Ime kho, ānanda, aṭṭha hetū, aṭṭha paccayā mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāyā”ti.
an8.70:21.3.eng: These are the eight causes and reasons for a great earthquake.”

an8.71:1.1.pli: “Saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti, no ca sīlavā.
an8.71:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant is faithful but not ethical.

an8.71:1.2.eng: So they’re incomplete in that respect,

an8.71:1.4.eng: ‘How can I become faithful and ethical?’

an8.71:1.5.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti sīlavā ca,
an8.71:1.5.eng: When the mendicant is faithful and ethical,

an8.71:2.1.pli: Saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti sīlavā ca, no ca bahussuto.
an8.71:2.1.eng: A mendicant is faithful and ethical, but not learned.

an8.71:2.2.eng: So they’re incomplete in that respect,

an8.71:2.4.pli: ‘kintāhaṃ saddho ca assaṃ, sīlavā ca, bahussuto cā’ti.
an8.71:2.4.eng: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and learned?’

an8.71:2.5.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti sīlavā ca bahussuto ca,
an8.71:2.5.eng: When the mendicant is faithful, ethical, and learned,

an8.71:3.1.pli: Saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti sīlavā ca bahussuto ca, no ca dhammakathiko …pe…
an8.71:3.1.eng: A mendicant is faithful, ethical, and learned, but not a Dhamma speaker. …

an8.71:3.3.pli: parisāvacaro ca, no ca visārado parisāya dhammaṃ deseti …pe…
an8.71:3.3.eng: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance …

an8.71:3.4.pli: visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseti, no ca catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī …pe…
an8.71:3.4.eng: they don’t get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in this life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty …

an8.71:3.5.pli: catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, no ca āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati;
an8.71:3.5.eng: they don’t realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an8.71:3.6.eng: So they’re incomplete in that respect,

an8.71:3.8.pli: ‘kintāhaṃ saddho ca assaṃ, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, catunnañca jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī assaṃ akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan’ti.
an8.71:3.8.eng: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, one who gets the four absorptions when they want, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements?’

an8.71:4.1.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseti, catunnañca jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati;
an8.71:4.1.eng: When they’re faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, one who gets the four absorptions when they want, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements,

an8.71:4.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu samantapāsādiko ca hoti sabbākāraparipūro cā”ti.
an8.71:4.3.eng: A mendicant who possesses these eight qualities is impressive all around, and is complete in every respect.”

an8.72:1.1.pli: “Saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti, no ca sīlavā.
an8.72:1.1.eng: “A mendicant is faithful, but not ethical.

an8.72:1.2.eng: So they’re incomplete in that respect,

an8.72:1.4.eng: ‘How can I become faithful and ethical?’

an8.72:1.5.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti sīlavā ca,
an8.72:1.5.eng: When the mendicant is faithful and ethical,

an8.72:2.1.pli: Saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti sīlavā ca, no ca bahussuto …pe…
an8.72:2.1.eng: A mendicant is faithful and ethical, but not learned. …

an8.72:2.4.pli: parisāvacaro ca, no ca visārado parisāya dhammaṃ deseti …pe…
an8.72:2.4.eng: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance …

an8.72:2.5.pli: visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseti, no ca ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te kāyena phusitvā viharati …pe…
an8.72:2.5.eng: they don’t have direct meditative experience of the peaceful liberations that are formless, transcending form …

an8.72:2.6.pli: ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te kāyena phusitvā viharati, no ca āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati;
an8.72:2.6.eng: they don’t realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an8.72:2.7.eng: So they’re incomplete in that respect,

an8.72:2.9.pli: ‘kintāhaṃ saddho ca assaṃ, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te kāyena phusitvā vihareyyaṃ, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan’ti.
an8.72:2.9.eng: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, one who gets the formless liberations, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements?’

an8.72:3.1.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseti. Ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te ca kāyena phusitvā viharati, āsavānañca khayā …pe… sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati;
an8.72:3.1.eng: When they’re faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, one who gets the formless liberations, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements,

an8.72:3.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu samantapāsādiko ca hoti sabbākāraparipūro cā”ti.
an8.72:3.3.eng: A mendicant who possesses these eight qualities is impressive all around, and is complete in every respect.”
